channel.title: [PI] Multicombat not working
channel.description:
Hey guys, I created a Godwars area and the area i have it in does not originally have multicombat, I have added it on the NPC.java and that works fine and comes up with the little crossed swords. But when me and my friend tried it only one of us could attack each monster at one time. Someone suggested changing it in the NPCHandler too, but i don't see where I have to change!
Here is what i have in NPC.java
[code=java] public boolean inMulti() { if ((absX >= 3136 && absX <= 3327 && absY >= 3519 && absY <= 3607) || (absX >= 3190 && absX <= 3327 && absY >= 3648 && absY <= 3839) || (absX >= 3200 && absX <= 3390 && absY >= 3840 && absY <= 3967) || (absX >= 2992 && absX <= 3007 && absY >= 3912 && absY <= 3967) || (absX >= 2946 && absX <= 2959 && absY >= 3816 && absY <= 3831) || (absX >= 3008 && absX <= 3199 && absY >= 3856 && absY <= 3903) || (absX >= 3008 && absX <= 3071 && absY >= 3600 && absY <= 3711) || (absX >= 3072 && absX <= 3327 && absY >= 3608 && absY <= 3647) || (absX >= 2624 && absX <= 2690 && absY >= 2550 && absY <= 2619) || (absX >= 2371 && absX <= 2422 && absY >= 5062 && absY <= 5117) || (absX >= 2896 && absX <= 2927 && absY >= 3595 && absY <= 3630) || (absX >= 2892 && absX <= 2932 && absY >= 4435 && absY <= 4464) || (absX >= 2256 && absX <= 2287 && absY >= 4680 && absY <= 4711) || (absX >= 3157 && absX <= 3191 && absY >= 2965 && absY <= 2995) || (absX >= 3466 && absX <= 3506 && absY >= 9484 && absY <= 9518) || (absX >= 2785 && absX <= 2809 && absY >= 2775 && absY <= 2795) || (absX >= 2624 && absX <= 2665 && absY >= 9510 && absY <= 9551)) { return true; } return false; } [/code]
What's going wrong?!

item.title: [PI] Multicombat not working
item.dc:creator: @ProximityPlus ProximityPlus
item.description:
@ProximityPlus wrote:

[quote=“WowILikeToCode, post:2, topic:420314”] || (absX >= 3466 && absX <= 3506 && absY >= 9484 && absY <= 9518)

I know a few people have problems with this code so let me explain it for you

Basically, All this does is draw a box. making any area inside this box multi combat.

That is the format your code should use. some people get it wrong so try that and if that doesn’t work reply and i’ll try to help[/quote]

The box works fine and i know that because the multicombat icon comes up when i enter it, but the npcs can only be attacked by one person.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Multicombat not working
item.dc:creator: @WowILikeToCode WowILikeToCode
item.description:
@WowILikeToCode wrote:


I know a few people have problems with this code so let me explain it for you

[code]                                || (absX >= SWXX && absX <= NEXX && absY >= SWYY && absY <= NEYY)[/code]

Basically, All this does is draw a box. making any area inside this box multi combat.

That is the format your code should use. some people get it wrong so try that and if that doesn't work reply and i'll try to help

I know a few people have problems with this code so let me explain it for you

Basically, All this does is draw a box. making any area inside this box multi combat.

That is the format your code should use. some people get it wrong so try that and if that doesn’t work reply and i’ll try to help

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Multicombat not working
item.dc:creator: @ProximityPlus ProximityPlus
item.description:
@ProximityPlus wrote:

Hey guys, I created a Godwars area and the area i have it in does not originally have multicombat, I have added it on the NPC.java and that works fine and comes up with the little crossed swords. But when me and my friend tried it only one of us could attack each monster at one time. Someone suggested changing it in the NPCHandler too, but i don’t see where I have to change!

Here is what i have in NPC.java

	public boolean inMulti() {
		if ((absX >= 3136 && absX <= 3327 && absY >= 3519 && absY <= 3607)
				|| (absX >= 3190 && absX <= 3327 && absY >= 3648 && absY <= 3839)
				|| (absX >= 3200 && absX <= 3390 && absY >= 3840 && absY <= 3967)
				|| (absX >= 2992 && absX <= 3007 && absY >= 3912 && absY <= 3967)
				|| (absX >= 2946 && absX <= 2959 && absY >= 3816 && absY <= 3831)
				|| (absX >= 3008 && absX <= 3199 && absY >= 3856 && absY <= 3903)
				|| (absX >= 3008 && absX <= 3071 && absY >= 3600 && absY <= 3711)
				|| (absX >= 3072 && absX <= 3327 && absY >= 3608 && absY <= 3647)
				|| (absX >= 2624 && absX <= 2690 && absY >= 2550 && absY <= 2619)
				|| (absX >= 2371 && absX <= 2422 && absY >= 5062 && absY <= 5117)
				|| (absX >= 2896 && absX <= 2927 && absY >= 3595 && absY <= 3630)
				|| (absX >= 2892 && absX <= 2932 && absY >= 4435 && absY <= 4464)
				|| (absX >= 2256 && absX <= 2287 && absY >= 4680 && absY <= 4711)
				|| (absX >= 3157 && absX <= 3191 && absY >= 2965 && absY <= 2995)
				|| (absX >= 3466 && absX <= 3506 && absY >= 9484 && absY <= 9518)
				|| (absX >= 2785 && absX <= 2809 && absY >= 2775 && absY <= 2795)
				|| (absX >= 2624 && absX <= 2665 && absY >= 9510 && absY <= 9551)) {
			return true;
		}
		return false;
	}

What’s going wrong?!

Read full topic
